messages.message: Additional documentation of the vehicle that was hit by a explosive in the Nur Shams camp in Tulkarm.
IDF forces are evacuating a military vehicle that was hit by an explosive device during an operation in the Nur Shams refugee camp in Tulkarm.

2c537fd6-c743-4e0a-b290-ea3d7bbc97ca.location: The explosion occurred in Nur Shams camp in Tulkarm, a Palestinian refugee camp in the West Bank.

messages.message:
Russian forces attacked Ukraine's two largest cities on Sunday, with missile fragments falling on a suburban Kyiv apartment building and a guided bomb killing one person in Kharkiv.
More than 28 months into Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Russian forces maintain regular attacks on Ukrainian cities as well as on energy infrastructure.
Attacks on Kyiv are less frequent than other cities, although the capital endured a series of assaults in March.
Russian forces were prevented from advancing on Kyiv in the early weeks of the February 2022 invasion and were redeployed along the 1,000-km (600-mile) front line in the east.
"The sooner the world helps us deal with the Russian combat aircraft launching these bombs, the sooner we can strike - justifiably strike – Russian military infrastructure...and the closer we will be to peace," he said.

Russian forces attacked Ukraine’s two largest cities on Sunday (30 June), with missile fragments falling on a suburban Kyiv apartment building and a guided bomb killing one person in Kharkiv.
More than 28 months into Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Russian forces maintain regular attacks on Ukrainian cities as well as on energy infrastructure.
Attacks on Kyiv are less frequent than other cities, although the capital endured a series of assaults in March.
Russia says Ukraine launched scores of dronesRussia’s air defence systems destroyed 36 drones that Ukraine launched at three regions bordering Ukraine, Russia’s defence ministry said on Monday.
Kyiv has said attacks on Russia’s military, transport and energy infrastructure are in response to Moscow’s continuous attacks on Ukraine’s territory since the start of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

Israeli troops carried out an airstrike in the northern West Bank on Sunday, killing a Palestinian militant and wounding five other people, Palestinian health officials said.
The strike took place in Nur Shams, an urban refugee camp that has been a frequent target of the Israeli military and is known as a stronghold of Palestinian militants.
The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.
The Palestinian Health Ministry says over 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank since the start of the war.
Israeli forces have been battling Palestinian militants in an eastern part of Gaza City, Shijaiyah, in recent days.

NUR SHAMS REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank — Israeli troops carried out an airstrike in the northern West Bank on Sunday, killing a Palestinian militant and wounding five other people, Palestinian health officials said.
The strike took place in Nur Shams, an urban refugee camp that has been a frequent target of the Israeli military and is known as a stronghold of Palestinian militants.
The state-run Palestinian news agency Wafa said an Israeli drone fired three missiles and struck a house.
Wafa said he had escaped a previous drone strike on June 20.
The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.

NUR SHAMS REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank -Israeli troops carried out an airstrike in the northern West Bank on Sunday, killing a Palestinian militant and wounding five other people, Palestinian health officials said.
The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.
The Palestinian Health Ministry says over 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank since the start of the war.
Israeli forces have been battling Palestinian militants in an eastern part of Gaza City, Shijaiyah, in recent days.
The Israeli military said an explosive drone launched by Hezbollah crashed into the Golan Heights on Sunday, severely wounding a soldier and lightly hurting 17 others.

North Korea fires two ballistic missiles: South Korea militaryA man watches a television screen showing a news broadcast with file footage of a North Korean missile test, at a train station in Seoul on July 1, 2024.
SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea on Monday launched two ballistic missiles, South Korea's military confirmed -- the latest in a series of weapons tests by Pyongyang that have soured relations with Seoul.
A short-range ballistic missile was launched in the early morning hours, the South's military Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement.
In response to the North's repeated launches, South Korea has fully suspended a tension-reducing military treaty.
The three-day "Freedom Edge" exercises included preparation in ballistic missile and air defences, anti-submarine warfare and defensive cyber training.

North Korea launched two ballistic missiles; South Korea's military confirmed - the latest in a series of weapons tests by Pyongyang that have soured relations with Seoul.
A short-range ballistic missile was launched in the early morning hours, the South's military Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement.
In response to the North's repeated launches, South Korea has fully suspended a tension-reducing military treaty.
South Korea also has grown anxious over the North's warming relations with its isolated neighbour Russia.
North Korea condemned joint military drills by South Korea, Japan and the United States, calling them an "Asian version of NATO" and warning of "fatal consequences".

The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.

Israeli troops have carried out an airstrike in the northern West Bank, killing a Palestinian militant and wounding five other people, Palestinian health officials said.
The strike took place Sunday in Nour Shams, an urban refugee camp that has been a frequent target of the Israeli military and is known as a stronghold of Palestinian militants.
The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.
The Palestinian Health Ministry says over 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank since the start of the war.

Palestinian official news agency Wafa said the strike was carried out with a drone that hit a house in Nur Shams refugee camp, near the town of Tulkarm in northern West Bank.
The Ramallah-based health ministry said a Palestinian man was killed and five other people were wounded “following a strike by the (Israeli) occupation”.
The Israeli military said in a statement that its forces had struck an apartment used by “wanted terrorists” in the Tulkarm area.
Israel has occupied the West Bank since 1967.
Attacks by Palestinians in the West Bank over the same period have killed at least 15 Israelis including soldiers.

July 1, 2024 — Nur Shams (Palestinian Territories) (AFP)Palestinian officials said an Israeli raid Monday killed a woman and a child in a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank, where a militant was killed the day before.
The Palestinian health ministry said in a statement that the woman and the child were killed in Nur Shams camp, near the northern West Bank town of Tulkarm.
The Ramallah-based health ministry said five others were wounded in the strike, including two who were in critical condition.
Already soaring violence in the West Bank, which Israel has occupied since 1967, has further surged since the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza broke out on October 7.
In the West Bank, at least 556 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli soldiers and settlers since October 7, according to a health ministry tally.

Israeli strikes rock Gaza City's Shujaiya for fourth dayGAZA STRIPSmoke billows from an area targeted by Israeli bombardment in the Gaza City district of Shujaiya on June 28, 2024.
Heavy battles and bombardment hit Gaza City's Shujaiya district for a fourth day on Sunday, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu acknowledged his forces were engaged in a "difficult fight".
Netanyahu said Israeli "forces are operating in Rafah, Shujaiya, everywhere in the Gaza Strip".
The Israeli military launched a ground operation in the southern city in early May, leading to the closure of a key aid crossing.
Hamas has called for a permanent ceasefire and full Israeli withdrawal from Gaza, demands repeatedly rejected by Israel.

GAZA STRIP, Palestinian Territories, July 1, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - Heavy battles and bombardment hit Gaza City's Shujaiya district for a fourth day on Sunday, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu acknowledged his forces were engaged in a "difficult fight".
Netanyahu said Israeli "forces are operating in Rafah, Shujaiya, everywhere in the Gaza Strip".
The militants also seized 251 hostages, 116 of whom remain in Gaza including 42 the army says are dead.
The Israeli military launched a ground operation in the southern city in early May, leading to the closure of a key aid crossing.
Hamas has called for a permanent ceasefire and full Israeli withdrawal from Gaza, demands repeatedly rejected by Israel.

HEAVY BATTLES AND bombardment hit Gaza City’s Shujaiya district for a fourth day on Sunday, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu acknowledged his forces were engaged in a “difficult fight”.
People leave their home in the neighborhood of Shujaiya in the east of Gaza City, on 27 June, 2024.
“We do not know where to go to protect ourselves.”Netanyahu said Israeli “forces are operating in Rafah, Shujaiya, everywhere in the Gaza Strip”.
The Israeli military launched a ground operation in the southern city in early May, leading to the closure of a key aid crossing.
Wafaa Elwan, displaced from Gaza City, said there was “no clean water” or basic hygiene products available at the tent city.

In Newfoundlandand Labrador, it is a day of mourning for one of the bloodiest battles of the First World War.
Thirty minutes.”Left: St. John's Road, a support trench in Beaumont Hamel in France, is seen before the start of fighting on July 1, 1916.
A special honourAn unidentified soldier from Newfoundland and Labrador who died on the battlefield at Beaumont Hamel was buried in an unmarked grave in France.
Outside Ottawa, Newfoundland and Labrador is the only province to have a National War Memorial and Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.
Why is the Unknown Soldier still unknown?

The Dominion of Newfoundland – as it was called at the time – had some 800 men fight on the fields of Beaumont Hamel, in France, on July 1, 1916.
Thirty minutes.”Left: St. John's Road, a support trench in Beaumont Hamel in France, is seen before the start of fighting on July 1, 1916.
Why is the Unknown Soldier still unknown?
Sarah Lockyer, a forensic anthropologist with the Canadian Armed Forces who worked on exhuming the remains in Beaumont Hamel, has mixed emotions about the process.
The province’s best-known troubadour, Alan Doyle co-wrote with Cory Tetford “Into the Arms of Home” after he was inspired by a visit to Beaumont Hamel himself.

The unknown Newfoundland soldier was lowered into a black granite tomb at around 11 a.m. local time at the National War Memorial in St. John’s.
Approximately 12,000 men from Newfoundland enlisted to fight in the First World War, and more than 3,500 were wounded or killed, according to Heritage Newfoundland and Labrador.
Monday’s ceremony laying the Unknown Soldier to rest in their homeland coincided with the 100th anniversary of the unveiling of the National War Memorial in St. John’s.
The soldier’s tomb will represent deceased Newfoundlanders and Labradorians from all branches of service who have no known grave, and thus the soldier’s identity will not be investigated.
Before the temporary cover was placed over the Unknown Soldier’s tomb, it was sprinkled with 820 blue forget-me-nots, representing the 820 Newfoundland soldiers who fought in the First World War and have no known grave.

The unknown Newfoundland soldier was lowered into a black granite tomb at around 11 a.m. local time at the National War Memorial in St. John’s.
Members of the Royal Newfoundland Regiment stand guard over the remains of an Unknown Newfoundland soldier as he lies in state at the Confederation Building in St. John's on Friday, June 28, 2024.
Approximately 12,000 men from Newfoundland enlisted to fight in the First World War, and more than 3,500 were wounded or killed, according to Heritage Newfoundland and Labrador.
